column2: (v.) to shake, stir up; start, provoke; displace, trouble, upset; jolt awake
(n.) fight, fight in close quarters, battle, combat, engagement
(v.) to delight, please, amuse, fascinate; charm, lure, entice; enjoy
(v.) to break, burst, tear, rupture, burst in pieces, force open
(adv.) only, merely, solely, simply, but, no more than
(v.) to appear, come in sight, make an appearance
(proper n.) a Roman female name (nomen – name of a Roman gens)
(adv.) to where, in where, where; for which reason, to what end, why, in order that, so that
(proper n.) Gaius, a Roman male name (praenomen) abbreviated C.
(n.) multitude, great number; crowd; rabble, mob
(conj.) while, a while, now, yet; so long as, provided that, if only; until, until that
(n.) footstep, step, footprint; trace, mark, track, vestige
(adj./adv.) in opposition, opposite, face to face; in turn, in return, back, on the other hand, likewise (with acc.)
(adj.) of another, belonging to another, not one’s own, foreign, alien, strange
(adv.) often, oft, oftentimes, many times, frequently
(v.) to lie down, be prostrate, lie at rest
(v.) to prefer, incline toward, wish rather
(n.) wrestler, boxer, athlete, one who is in public games; expert
(n.) commander, leader, chief, director, ruler, general, emperor
